description.narrative: Independent institutions and civil society effectively monitor, advocate and report on realization of child rights, which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: All children have enhanced access to justice and benefit from strengthened mechanisms for monitoring and addressing human rights violations

title.narrative: Independent institutions and civil society effectively monitor, advocate and report on realization of child rights

description.narrative: Civil society organizations for children supported by UNICEF effectively advocated for child rights issues, particularly of the most vulnerable children. A highlight of the cooperation with CSOs and independent institutions was the youth-centred Voluntary National Report consultation process led by UNICEF. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/12/2019
